migrationStep.completed1: Great! You have completed the first of two migration steps.
migrationStep.completed2:
Don't forget to invite your followers to sign up on OpenPortability. In 1 minute they can be reconnected to your account, even without their archive.
Phase 2 of reconnection will occur in a few days. Depending on your preferences, you will receive an email notification or can follow the launch on our X, BlueSky and Mastodon accounts.
Stay tuned, great surprises await you!
migrationStep.nextSteps: Complete the following steps to sail towards new horizons!

upload.title: Import your X/Twitter archive to continue your journey
upload.action: Drop or select your X/Twitter archive here
upload.description:
Three data formats are accepted:
- your original X archive if <1GB (in Zip format)
- the following.js and follower.js files TOGETHER and not zipped,
- the split versions of these files for large archives (following-part*.js + follower-part*.js).
In all cases, only the followers/following lists are transmitted

loading.uploading: Please don't leave the page, import is in progress

upload.loading-uploading: Stay on the page, import in progress

logoCNRS.alt: CNRS, National Center for Scientific Research

helpModal.title: How to get your X/Twitter archive?
helpModal.description: To get your X/Twitter archive, follow these steps:
steps: Sign in to your X/Twitter account
Go to "More" in the left menu
Click on "Settings and support" then "Settings and privacy"
In "Your account", select "Download an archive of your data"
X/Twitter will send you an email when your archive is ready to download
Once downloaded, you can import the .zip file here
helpModal.note: Note: X/Twitter archive preparation can take up to 24 hours.

errors.invalidCombination: Please upload either a ZIP file, the following.js + follower.js files TOGETHER, or their split versions (following-part*.js/follower-part*.js)

firstSeen.title: Welcome!
firstSeen.description:
You are about to register yourself in the social web GPS and exercise your right to data portability from X to BlueSky and/or Mastodon while participating in a research project on social networks. This will take 5 minutes.

OpenPortability will register your digital identities and allow you to gradually recreate your community on BlueSky and/or Mastodon, with no impact on your X account.

As other users sign up on OpenPortability, the links referenced on X will be recreated on BlueSky or Mastodon with their consent. Don't hesitate to encourage your followers to do the same!

This "copy" of your social network may take several days.
If you choose to appear in the social web GPS (see preferences), our users will be able to discover your account and follow you.

By using OpenPortability, you agree that your data will be processed in accordance with {lien} and consent to the possible transfer of your data outside the European Union (e.g. BlueSky servers).

privacy_policy.title: Data Protection Information Notice
privacy_policy.subtitle: Institute of Complex Systems Paris Ile de France | January 2025
privacy_policy.content:
CNRS ISC PIF

Data Protection Information Notice for the Scientific Research Project Open Portability

Social networks and in particular Twitter (now X) have been privileged research objects from the beginning, notably in the field of computational social sciences.

A major transition is underway in the social media landscape. The centralized model, embodied by X (formerly Twitter), is experiencing a massive exodus of users to alternative platforms such as BlueSky and Mastodon. Several million accounts migrated in just weeks, marking a major shift towards decentralized and open networks.

This transition is a major social, economic and technological phenomenon that may reshape the global digital space, particularly European, and could help Europe regain some digital sovereignty.

I. Description of the project and processing

The research objectives are as follows: to analyze the difference between open and closed digital environments of the micro-blogging type from the perspective of social dynamics and online debates. To study as a case study the ongoing migration between X and spaces based on the AT Protocol and Activity Pub open protocols and to study the appropriation of decentralized digital spaces over time (5-year horizon).

The OpenPortability project involves:

  • Data collection for data portability between social networks
  • Data collection for a snapshot of the social structure of the X network
  • Data collection for snapshots of the social structures of alternative networks
  • Data portability
  • Data processing and analysis

II. Data collection, recipients and retention

Data collected directly from people and processed are:

  • Digital identifiers on social networks (user name ID)
  • Profile names on social networks
  • Email addresses

Bluesky's personal data protection policy is available on: https://bsky.social/about/support/privacy-policy

Mastodon's personal data protection policy is available on https://joinmastodon.org/servers

III. Security Measures

To ensure confidentiality and data protection, measures are taken in accordance with the State's information systems security policy, applied to the CNRS. Data is hosted in France on CNRS servers.

IV. Exercise of Your Rights

You can access and obtain a copy of the data concerning you, object to the processing of this data or have it corrected. You also have the right to limit the processing of your data. You can exercise these rights by contacting the data controller at the Institute of Complex Systems-Paris Ile de France, located at 113 rue Nationale 75013 Paris, or using the contact form available on https://openportability.org/

You can also contact the CNRS Data Protection Officer at the following address: CNRS - Data Protection Service, 2 rue Jean Zay, 54519 Vandoeuvre-l√®s-Nancy - dpd.demandes@cnrs.fr.

If you believe that your data protection rights are not being respected, you have the option to lodge a complaint online with the CNIL, 3 Place de Fontenoy, TSA 80715 ‚Äì 75334 Paris Cedex 07 (https://www.cnil.fr/).

step1.title: Explore the Social Graph
step1.description: Navigate among 650,000+ X/Twitter accounts visualized through their connections. Each dot represents an account, colored by interest community.
step1.controls:
Wheel = Zoom
Click + Drag = Move
Click = Select

step2.title: Three View Modes
step2.description: Switch between Discover (explore all), Following (your following) and Followers (your followers). Your personal network is highlighted when you select a mode.

step3.title: Lasso Selection
step3.description: Draw a selection on the map to discover key accounts in the area. Perfect for exploring communities!
step3.controls:
Click the Lasso tool in the toolbar
Draw a shape
The area stats appear in the panel

step4.title: Reconnection Panel
step4.description: The right panel displays accounts you can reconnect with on Bluesky and Mastodon. Select and click 'Reconnect' to follow them.
